intro: Koanophyllon jinotegense, commonly known as the Jinotega grass, is a flowering plant species native to Central America, particularly found in Nicaragua. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic properties. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are yellow in color. Koanophyllon jinotegense is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
